title: Magic Eden Launches Cross-Chain NFT and Crypto Wallet for Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, and Polygon - Decrypt
content:
Your Web3 Gaming Power-Up Enjoy exclusive benefits with the GG Membership Pass

Decrypt’s Art, Fashion, and Entertainment Hub. Discover SCENE

Magic Eden sees a crypto future that spans multiple blockchains—and is launching its crypto wallet browser extension in closed beta to support that aim, the firm behind the NFT marketplace announced Monday.

“We believe in a multi-chain world for NFTs,” Magic Eden CEO and co-founder Jack Lu told Decrypt in an interview.

“Up until today, for a user to really experience all the different products and features and great content that we have on every chain, they effectively have to download three wallets,” Lu said of the current challenges plaguing the wallet space that have led to user fragmentation on Magic Eden.

AD

AD

The marketplace’s crypto wallet is launching for the Google Chrome browser first, but a Safari browser version and mobile app are also in the works. The mobile app could come into fruition as soon as early 2024, Lu shared.

The wallet will be compatible with the four blockchains that Magic Eden currently supports on its NFT marketplace: Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, and Ethereum scaling network Polygon.

The initial Magic Eden wallet will be self-custodied, meaning users will have full control over their crypto assets and will have to keep a seed phrase—a lengthy passphrase consisting of many words—secure.

But if downloading three different crypto wallets to buy NFTs on Ethereum, Solana, and Bitcoin is frustrating and cumbersome for users, why still make them deal with seed phrases at all? Why not offer a Magic Eden-custodied wallet with a one-click email solution instead?

Lu said that holding your own crypto and NFTs is crucial to “the ethos of Web3.”

AD

AD

Introducing Magic Eden Wallet, a wallet made for Magic Eden users and cross-chain collectors. Beta version is now live and only available to a small group of early testers! Want to give it a try? You can get on the waiting list by downloading the extension and entering your… pic.twitter.com/5DsS5qhdlQ — Magic Eden 🪄 (@MagicEden) November 27, 2023

“We very much want to live up to that,” Lu said of Magic Eden’s belief in Web3, a term which refers to a hypothesized next iteration of the internet that offers users decentralized ownership through crypto. “That’s why we wanted to stick to something self-custodial.”

Magic Eden’s wallet promises a more user-friendly, cross-chain solution for crypto fans, allowing them to avoid bridging (transferring crypto from one chain to another) by doing cross-chain token swaps through the wallet.

Lu is also very much aware of the common issues that afflict crypto browser extensions. For instance, when users have multiple wallets installed—like MetaMask, Coinbase Wallet, Phantom, or the Ronin Wallet, for example—they can occasionally “fight” each other to connect to a website, simultaneously popping up at once and creating connection issues and confusion.

“We're actually working pretty deeply right now to make sure that the wallets don't fight each other as much,” Lu said, citing Magic Eden’s work on its wallet with crypto tech firm Exodus.

In addition to cross-chain swaps, the Magic Eden wallet will also offer users the ability to buy crypto with fiat currency from within the wallet through a MoonPay integration, Lu said. The wallet will include NFT-focused features like cross-chain portfolio tracking, Bitcoin Ordinals support, and simultaneous connection to multiple blockchains.

“I think self-custody and email login—and those seamless implementations—they're not mutually exclusive,” Lu told Decrypt of the wallet’s potential future. “There’s a lot of very exciting technologies that we're looking to tap into to make that onboarding experience much more smooth, much more familiar to the mainstream user.”

Edited by Andrew Hayward

AD

title: MILESTONE | Newly Launched Ethereum Layer 2, Blast, Draws Over $500 Million in Deposits in a Few Days - bitcoinke.io
content:
Blast, a recently launched Ethereum layer-2 blockchain, experienced an unusual surge in assets with an inflow of over $500 million a few days after its introduction on November 212023.

Introducing Blast: The only Ethereum L2 with native yield for ETH and stablecoins. We’ve raised $20m from @Paradigm and @StandardCrypto to build the L2 that helps you earn more. Details on how to get early access at the end of the thread👇 pic.twitter.com/AYYmK8YFx4 — Blast (@Blast_L2) November 20, 2023

Layer 2 networks are the hottest projects in crypto in 2023. These networks, which operate on top of layer 1 blockchains like Ethereum, address issues related to speed, cost, and scalability. Blast utilizes bridges, blockchain-based tools that facilitate the transfer of tokens between different networks.

Blast incorporates a native staking feature that aims to generate returns by combining Ethereum staking with real-world assets, providing users with a unique opportunity for investment growth. Depositors start earning yields on the transferred Ether alongside BLAST points.

“Blast natively participates in ETH staking, and the staking yield is passed back to the L2’s users and dapps,” the team said.

“We’ve redesigned the L2 from the ground up so that if you have 1 ETH in your wallet on Blast, over time, it grows to 1.04, 1.08, 1.12 ETH automatically.”

Out of the total funds bridged, more than $500 million in Ether has been staked on Lido, as of this writing, offering an annualized yield of up to 4%. Additionally, there’s $63 million on Maker, and $468k held in its wallets.

Users are required to wait until the mainnet launch in February 2024 before being able to withdraw funds from the network or engage in on-chain activities. Blast Bridge is currently invite-only, with access granted through a code from invited users. Additionally, the redemption of BLAST points is set to commence in May 2024.

Blast secured over $20 million in a funding round led by Paradigm and Standard Crypto. The project is led by the pseudonymous @PacmanBlur, who is also one of the co-founders of the NFT marketplace, Blur.

title: Cardano founder slams Ethereum's staking overhaul plans - Finbold - Finance in Bold
content:
Not long after sharing the details regarding the decentralization of the Cardano (ADA) ecosystem, Charles Hoskinson, the founder of its blockchain development firm Input Output Global (IOG), has criticized Ethereum (ETH) plans for staking structure redesign shared by the platform’s co-founder Vitalik Buterin.

As it happens, Hoskinson took a jab at Ethereum as he commented on a video of Buterin admitting to the overly centralized nature of current staking on the platform and describing plans to redesign its staking operations in an X post shared by user Stake with Pride on November 24.

No worries, Ethereum 3 will have it all sorted! https://t.co/Td0Hm58eic — Charles Hoskinson (@IOHK_Charles) November 24, 2023

Furthermore, responding to the comment noting that he was “fuelling hostility” with Ethereum, Hoskinson refuted such observations, arguing that Vitalik was “rediscovering what we’ve been working on for almost a decade, and it’s like a new revelation,” adding that it was “extraordinary that we never get a shout-out.”

Cardano vs. Ethereum decentralization

As a reminder, the Cardano founder had poked fun at Buterin and his ideas before as well, like in early October, when the Ethereum pioneer shared a post listing the advantages of suggested changes in staking design for users who do not have enough resources to stake on their own.

Meanwhile, Hoskinson recently revealed Cardano’s upcoming moves toward the “full-blown” decentralized governance structure as it enters the Voltaire era in its roadmap, including through the movements of all repositories to a community-run project called Intersect, as Finbold reported on November 17.

Elsewhere, Cardano’s ADA token was at press time trading at the price of $0.381, which shows a decline of 2.50% on the day and a loss of 2.83% across the previous week while it still holds onto the gain of 30.08% on its monthly chart, according to the data on November 27.

title: Ethereum Dominance Indicator: Key Barometer of Trends in the Crypto Sector - Cryptopolitan
content:
From its early days, Ethereum has distinguished itself as a hub of groundbreaking developments in blockchain technology. As the originator of smart contracts, Ethereum has redefined the scope of blockchain applications, paving the way for a diverse range of DApps, innovative DeFi platforms, and the rapidly expanding universe of NFTs. These strides have solidified Ethereum dominance in the blockchain space and have also been instrumental in its market dominance.

Ethereum’s journey and commanding market position intertwine with its core ethos of decentralization. This principle has garnered both acclaim and debate within the crypto community. As Ethereum continues to adapt and upgrade in response to the industry’s challenges, its market dominance remains a key barometer of the evolving trends in the cryptocurrency sector.

The Rise of Ethereum

Ethereum’s journey began as a vision in the mind of Vitalik Buterin, a programmer and co-founder of Bitcoin Magazine. Dissatisfied with Bitcoin’s limitations, Buterin proposed a new platform in late 2013, one that would go beyond the financial use cases of Bitcoin. Ethereum’s official launch in 2015 marked a pivotal moment in the history of blockchain technology. It wasn’t just another cryptocurrency but a revolutionary platform designed to leverage blockchain technology for many applications far beyond digital currencies.

The true game-changer for Ethereum was the introduction of smart contracts. These are self-executing contracts with the terms of the agreement directly written into lines of code. Smart contracts operate autonomously and are immutable once deployed, ensuring high trust and security in digital transactions. This innovation opened the door to endless possibilities, allowing developers to create sophisticated DApps without intermediaries.

Being the first to market with such a versatile technology, Ethereum quickly established itself as the de facto platform for blockchain development. This first-mover advantage was crucial. It allowed Ethereum to build a strong community of developers and enthusiasts eager to explore and expand the capabilities of blockchain technology. This early start also meant that Ethereum became the standard for measuring other blockchain platforms.

Expansion of Ethereum’s Ecosystem

Ethereum’s ecosystem saw exponential growth with the rise of DApps. These applications, from games to social networks, operate on a peer-to-peer network free from central control. Ethereum’s flexible platform enabled developers to build a wide array of DApps, attracting a diverse user base to the Ethereum network.

One of the most significant developments in Ethereum’s ecosystem has been the emergence of DeFi. These financial services, like lending, borrowing, and trading, operate on the blockchain without traditional financial intermediaries. Ethereum’s smart contract functionality made it an ideal platform for DeFi applications, leading to a surge in innovation and investment in this sector.

The NFT boom further underscored Ethereum’s dominance. NFTs are unique digital assets verified using blockchain technology, and Ethereum’s blockchain has been the primary platform for minting, buying, and selling NFTs. The popularity of NFTs brought mainstream attention to Ethereum and highlighted its capability to support a wide range of digital asset transactions.

Calculating Ethereum Dominance

In the digital currency landscape, ‘market capitalization’ or ‘market cap’ is critical. It represents the aggregate value of all available units of a specific cryptocurrency. To calculate this, one multiplies the current price of a single unit by the total number of units in circulation. This metric is pivotal for comparing cryptocurrencies’ relative size and value, offering a snapshot of their financial footprint in the digital economy.

It’s essential to juxtapose its market cap with the cumulative market cap of the global cryptocurrency market to grasp the extent of Ethereum’s influence. This total market cap encompasses the combined value of all cryptocurrencies, Ethereum included. This comparison sheds light on Ethereum’s financial stature and role in the expansive crypto market.

Ethereum’s market dominance has a simple yet revealing formula:

Ethereum’s Market Share (%) = (Ethereum’s Market Cap / Combined Market Cap of All Cryptocurrencies) * 100

This calculation presents Ethereum’s market share as a percentage, illustrating its portion of the cryptocurrency market. For example, if Ethereum’s market cap stands at $300 billion against a $1 trillion total market cap for all cryptocurrencies, its market share would be 30%. This figure is dynamic, fluctuating with the changing market values of Ethereum and crypto counterparts.

Ethereum Dominance on a monthly time frame.

More than just a numerical value, Ethereum’s market dominance is a barometer of its market strength and stability compared to other digital currencies. A higher percentage signifies Ethereum’s commanding presence and influence in the market. In contrast, a lower figure might indicate a more diverse and competitive cryptocurrency landscape. For investors and market analysts, Ethereum’s dominance is a key indicator, offering insights into market trends, investor confidence, and the overall vitality of the cryptocurrency market.

Factors Contributing to Ethereum Dominance

Decentralization as a Core Principle

At the heart of Ethereum’s philosophy and architecture is the principle of decentralization. This foundational aspect differentiates Ethereum from traditional centralized systems. Ethereum’s blockchain operates on a global network of computers, ensuring that no single entity has complete control over the entire network. This commitment to decentralization is evident in Ethereum’s open-source nature, allowing developers worldwide to contribute to its ecosystem enhancing security, transparency, and trust.

Despite its strong stance on decentralization, Ethereum has faced its share of criticism and debate. Some critics argue that Ethereum’s decentralization is not as robust as it claims, pointing to issues such as the concentration of power among a few large mining pools or validators and concerns over potential centralization in decision-making processes. These debates highlight the ongoing challenges Ethereum faces in maintaining a truly decentralized network while scaling and evolving.

Validator Count and Network Security

The security and integrity of the Ethereum network are paramount, and a critical factor in this is the number of validators. Validators are responsible for processing transactions and creating new blocks in the blockchain. Post-transition to a Proof-of-Stake (PoS) model, the number of validators has become a critical metric for network security. A higher number of validators means a more decentralized and secure network, as it becomes increasingly difficult for any single entity to gain control over the network.

Continuous Development and Upgrades

One of the most significant developments in Ethereum’s history is its transition from a Proof-of-Work (PoW) to a Proof-of-Stake (PoS) consensus mechanism, known as “The Merge.” This shift changed how Ethereum validates transactions and secures its network. The PoS model dramatically reduces energy consumption and is crucial for a more sustainable, scalable, and secure blockchain.

Ethereum’s journey has continuous improvement and upgrades. These include protocol enhancements to increase scalability, reduce transaction fees, and improve network efficiency. Notable upgrades, such as the Constantinople and Istanbul hard forks, have introduced significant network infrastructure changes, demonstrating Ethereum’s commitment to innovation and adaptation in the fast-evolving blockchain landscape.

Ethereum’s Rival Blockchains

Binance Smart Chain (BSC)

Binance Smart Chain is a formidable competitor known for its high throughput and low transaction fees. BSC operates parallel to Binance Chain and offers smart contract functionality and compatibility with Ethereum’s ecosystem, making it an attractive alternative for developers and users seeking efficiency and cost-effectiveness.

Cardano

Cardano distinguishes itself through its research-driven approach and emphasis on sustainability and scalability. It utilizes a unique proof-of-stake algorithm called Ouroboros. It aims to provide more advanced features than any protocol previously developed, making it a strong contender in the blockchain space.

Solana

Solana has gained attention for its swift transaction processing capabilities and low fees. It employs a novel consensus mechanism known as Proof of History (PoH), which contributes to its high throughput, positioning it as a highly efficient blockchain platform.

Avalanche

Avalanche stands out with its unique consensus mechanism, which allows for high transaction output without compromising scalability. Its design simultaneously addresses the blockchain trilemma of achieving decentralization, security, and scalability.

Comparison with Ethereum

Trade-offs in Scalability and Decentralization

While these rival blockchains offer various advantages, particularly scalability and transaction speed, they often face trade-offs, especially in decentralization. For instance, networks like BSC and Tron, while faster and more cost-effective, have faced criticism for being more centralized compared to Ethereum. This centralization can lead to concerns over security and censorship resistance.

Market Position and Innovations

Ethereum maintains a strong market position despite the competition due to its first-mover advantage, extensive developer community, and continuous innovations. While competitors like Cardano and Solana bring novel features and improvements, Ethereum’s ongoing upgrades and the shift to a Proof-of-Stake model with The Merge aim to address its scalability and efficiency issues, keeping it at the forefront of blockchain innovation.

Ethereum’s Market Influence

Pioneering the ICO Revolution

Ethereum’s introduction marked a turning point in fundraising within the digital realm, particularly with the advent of ICOs. This innovative fundraising method, which gained immense traction in 2017 and 2018, was fueled mainly by Ethereum’s smart contract capabilities. Startups and new ventures found a streamlined, accessible path to raise funds through token issuance on Ethereum’s platform, bypassing traditional funding routes. This era highlighted Ethereum’s technological prowess and ushered in a new era of investment and interest in the blockchain domain.

Leading the Charge in the NFT Marketplace

In the burgeoning world of NFTs, Ethereum’s role has been nothing short of foundational. As the primary platform for creating and exchanging NFTs, Ethereum has become synonymous with this novel digital asset class. Its ability to authenticate and secure unique digital items has positioned it as the preferred choice for a diverse array of artists, digital creators, and collectors. The meteoric rise of NFTs, especially in 2021, further cemented Ethereum’s standing as an innovator in blockchain applications.

Shaping the DeFi Landscape

Ethereum’s influence is profoundly evident in the DeFi sector. As the backbone for many DeFi applications, Ethereum has been instrumental in reshaping financial services. It has enabled a new, more open, inclusive financial ecosystem that operates independently of traditional financial intermediaries. This revolution in finance, driven by Ethereum’s smart contracts, has opened new avenues for financial interaction and redefined the concept of value exchange.

Cultivating a Robust Network and Developer Ecosystem

A critical factor in Ethereum’s enduring market influence is its expansive network effect and the dynamic developer community it has fostered. The platform’s value has exponentially increased as more users and developers engage, creating a virtuous cycle of growth and innovation. Ethereum boasts one of the most active and dedicated developer communities in the blockchain arena, a community that has been instrumental in driving the platform’s continuous evolution and adaptability. This collective effort has fortified Ethereum’s position in the face of new challenges and has also been pivotal in maintaining its edge in the competitive blockchain landscape.

Conclusion

The supremacy of Ethereum in the digital currency realm reflects its groundbreaking technology, expansive network, and visionary approach of its creators. Ethereum has been at the forefront of blockchain innovation, from its pioneering role in smart contract technology to its significant contributions in ICOs, NFTs, and DeFi. Despite the rise of new competitors, Ethereum’s dedication to ongoing development and its vibrant, engaged developer community solidify its pivotal role in the cryptocurrency universe. As Ethereum continues to evolve, its influence and leadership are poised to continue shaping the trajectory of blockchain technology and the future of digital finance.

title: Meme Moguls (MGLS) Surpasses Ethereum (ETH) and Ripple (XRP) in Impressive Market Performance - Crypto News Flash
content:

Ethereum (ETH) Shows Sell Signal, Says Ali Martinez

Ethereum (ETH) started this week on a bullish note rising above the $2,000 mark as high as $2,128. Unfortunately, Ethereum’s price has dipped to $2,000. Currently, various indicators suggest the likelihood of further declines in the coming days.

Even crypto traders like Ali Martinez share this opinion. According to Ali, Ethereum’s “TD Sequential” indicator is signaling a sell on the three-day Ethereum price chart. This comes as the asset tests a significant resistance range ranging from $2,000 to $2,150.

The analyst pointed at a possible price dump to $1,700. Currently, the price of Ethereum is showing mixed sentiment. It had dropped 2% on the daily chart while holding on to gains of 6.5% and 27.3% on the weekly and monthly Ethereum chart.

Ripple (XRP) Loses Gains After Recent XRP ETF Rumour

Ripple holders’ positive outlook has grown immensely since Ripple’s partial win against the US SEC in July. Ripple’s price increased by over 80% and reached the $0.8 level. Unfortunately, the bearish market led to high selling pressure as Ripple cryptocurrency lost its gains.

The Ripple crypto dropped as low as $0.5 before picking pace during the Uptober market rally. So far, Ripple coin’s November performance has been poor compared to other cryptocurrencies. Per CoinMarketCap, Ripple XRP price has dipped 3.4% to $0.6387.

Both its market cap and trading volume have dropped significantly, due to the recent fake BlackRock XRP ETF Trust filing. Still, Ripple’s technical indicators point towards a price recovery in the coming months to the $0.7 region.

Meme Moguls (MGLS), Bringing New Utility To the Meme Coin Sector

While Ethereum and XRP are losing gains, meme coins continue to take over the crypto space. The meme-based asset industry has gained significant recognition in recent years. According to Statistics, the meme coin sector has a market capitalization of over $17.5 billion.

The interesting part is that these meme coins have little to no utility. In response to this, Meme Moguls has emerged as a solution, as it seeks to launch a meme-backed stock market. The project’s objective is to unite the meme industry to foster a community for meme coin enthusiasts.

Users will gain access to memes-backed assets. The ecosystem will also encompass a wide range of services, all drawing inspiration from memes. A metaverse platform named Mogul Land will be introduced. This will enable meme traders to interact and mine tokens to enhance their returns.

Analysts have predicted significant growth for the MGLS token. Currently, Meme lovers have the opportunity to buy MGLS tokens at just $0.0019. Market experts are optimistic about the project and foresee a 1,000% increase in the coming months. Plus, joining the presale gives you a chance to earn up to $10,000 in giveaways at the end of the presale stage.
